post_title: Please help me this is driving me insane
post_body:
It feels like the game is randomly desyncing and I have zero control over if it will happen or not. This isn't the case of just having bad games or good games, the way the game plays and feels completely changes.

**When things are working correctly:**

* Enemies move normally
* They have peekers advantage but not to silly levels
* Hit reg is decent on them
* Tagging actually slows them down
* Getting hit with armor on doesn't impact my aim
* Win spray duels majority of the time

**When the desync hits:**

* Enemies have erratic out of sync looking movement at times, like my client is catching me up to their already performed movements/actions too late
* Peekers advantage is over the top
* Spray duels feel like a death sentence and half my bullets are blanks
* Tagging no longer appears to work as it should, they just dance around at full speed like nothing happened
* Getting hit while armored causing an aimpunch like effect that rattles my crosshair, normally combined with an over the top tagging that feels like I've been caught in a vice

This is something that could happen before but has gotten much worse with the recent updates. I have a stable 1 gig fiber connection so this really shouldn't happen, I watch the telemetry data like a hawk and outside of the very rare spikes that anyone would get, again it is incredibly stable. Something new is that at the start of a game in warmp up I'll get crazy rubberbanding/stutter for a few seconds that doesn't show in telemetry, followed by another wave of the same. This didn't use to happen before and I feel like it's linked somehow.

Another thing is that I've been looking at the console and I've been seeing a lot of "CQ: Server set re-sync at cmd" messages, whatever this means I'd like to know. Surely I'm not the only one, if anyone has a fix I'd love to know. I've flashed my BIOS to the most recent and I've downloaded the latest network drivers to no avail.

post_title: The MongolZ and CS glazing
post_body:
I want to emphasize how big of an achievement The Mongolz reaching the playoffs of the first Asian major is. This is reminiscent of Vitality winning in Paris, but somehow to me it's even bigger.

Coming from Asia I used to play with/against the first few players that eventually formed The Mongolz. Competing for a living was a pipe dream back then for asian players. Absolutely impossible considering the lack of sponsors, lack of pro experience, support from family (lol). We had to self organize and host local tournaments to keep the CS scene alive. 

On top of that add the heavy investments from EU/NA orgs compared to Asian orgs. Not only did the MongolZ stay relevant, they set their sights and achieved playoffs on a legit run at the first ever Asian major. This was unimaginable before The MongolZ and the gravity of their cultural impact is going to be massive.

Every top team faltered due to nerves/lack of prac, etc. The top players in race for #1 are not showing up on key maps. Imagine the mountain of pressure on a home team in the first major (and probably only Asian one for a while). Mongolz still gave it their all and played inspired CS. Go for the win!

Cherry on top while watching the exciting advancement match against Heroic was partly due to the excellent CS talent that we have. Couldn't have asked for more as an Asian fan for launders to cast the winning match, bleh building  the storylines. Also thanks scrawny for an epic winning moment commentary. Wasn't expecting to shed a tear while catching some CS.

post_title: Disabled Chinese Player Completed 1v5 Clutch With One Hand.
The crowd is the entire point of lan tourneys.
post_body:
Sucks for BIG and all, but this is all for entertainment, yall. The players are the gladiators, the arena is the Colosseum, and everyone is there to participate in the spectacle.

As long as the crowd reactions are to the play and not intentional favoritism, this is just something they need to understand and play around.

post_title: FL4MUS before NAVI: "Well, we took out s1mple, so we can do the same with his ex"
Why is CS so punishing, network-wise?
post_body:
Every other online game I play, mostly Rocket League and Valorant, my internet is fine, great even. Around 30-40 ping, with no teleports or similar "bad-network-related" stuff.

CS ever since the update where they changed the telemetry, regardless of if I'm using the setting that buffers everything by no ticks, 1 tick or 2 ticks, it just lags out ALL the time.

 Someone peeks me? Lag spike, slight teleport. I peek someone? Lag spike, slight teleport. Jiggle in and out of an angle? Lag spike, pushing me into one direction way more than I ever pressed the button. 

Can I do anything about this? As I mentioned, this did not happen before, and is only happening after the telemetry update. Ping is normal, sub50 all the time, I do have occasional jitter spikes, but as I said, it doesn't affect me in any other game as much as it does here in CS.

Tips to improve on a lower Dpi?
post_body:
After 1,200 hours I finally realised how high my sensitivity was with an eDpi of 4000 (or 1600 dpi and x2.5 mouse sens in-game). 

Now I'm thinking of lowering my mouse sens to x1.5 (eDpi of 2400) to start with. However, I'm so used to aimming with my wrist and don't have the desk space to use my arm to play currently.

So does anyone have any training tips or workshop maps I should use to help me ease into lowering my sens? Thanks!

post_title: Dreamhack Melbourne to not return in 2025, no plans to run events in Australia in the forseeable future
Weekly streak incentives
post_body:
I‚Äôm a huge CS nerd. I‚Äôve been playing the game for years, and when Valve added the streak system I just couldn‚Äôt help but see how far I could push it. I was a little bummed that once you get a red coin streak it doesn't scale any further. No big deal though, because I made it my personal goal to hit a 52 week streak. One full year of grinding the best FPS on the market. 

Funny enough I‚Äôve come across fellow nerds in my games trying to push their streaks to the limit as well. I was thinking, when the streak eventually does come to an end, it‚Äôll just disappear from my account. There‚Äôs no way other than a screenshot to show this accomplishment in game.

So I was thinking, what if Valve added a coin to the game to mark certain milestones in the streak? 52 weeks to mark a year? I think this would also add incentive for people to push the streaks too. Maybe every X amount of weeks adds a prestige level to your coin? I‚Äôm sure there could be something fun they could add to give us something to work towards.
